description.en: Cryptocat can be configured to connect through tor. MORE DETAILS HERE.

If anyone else discovers the 'Conversation Name' you are using, then they will be able to join that chat. As messages are not logged by Cryptocat servers, they will only be able to see messages after they join, and the Cryptocat interface will show you that they have joined. However, to minimise the chance of someone discovering your chat room, choose a long or randomised room name, and exchange this with your conversation partner(s) through some other secure channel.

practice.name: tor
trust: The randomly selected 'exit' node which passes your traffic on to the Internet.

function.name: Use a pseudonym

description.en: A pseudonym is a name you use instead of your usual name. It can be a nickname you use regularly (eg js360 is Jon Smith's email address and his username on a variety of websites) or something you use just once and no one will be able to guess is you (there is nothing to connect anon123abc to Jon Smith). The more often you use a pseudonym and the more people and services which know you use it, the less secure it is.

trust: Anyone who knows the connection between your pseudonym and real identity
